title: "Great Palce"
pros: YAAAAAAAAAAy awesome pay good atmosphere great managers enjoyable coworkers
cons: NOOOOOO schedule trades hours tied to phone training is too long

title: "Nationwide"
pros: Good benefits, cool company and place to work
cons: Did not love the work I was doing

title: "Nationwide"
pros: Nationwide has really focused on associates by providing development opportunities in their current role. Another big focus is associate engagement. You have the opportunity to voice your opinion and share ideas to problem solve or improve processes that improves efficiency. Senior Leadership's door is always open. You meet with your leader often to talk about your progress and provide support.
cons: Salary is middle of the road with often minimal raises at year end reviews.

title: "Claims Adjuster"
pros: Great benefits, stable company, Fair wages. Upper management seems to care about the people and career growth. Good place as entry level employee and training opportunities.
cons: Work- Life Balance is a struggle, as the job is demanding and requires commitment beyond regular work hours. Office closures caused job loss for some positions.

title: "Great Company- People Focused"
pros: I enjoy my position at Nationwide. They encourage personal development, job satisfaction, and work-life balance. Lots of humanitarian involvement, enablement, and thought leadership. The company overall compensates well, and provides an excellent benefits package.
cons: Salary/compensation is not necessarily the highest in the industry, however, I think this is balanced out with their dedication to their employees and community. The biggest drawback is they are lagging behind technologically. Some of this is due to strong focus on risk, cost, and other factors that are necessary, however, it impairs our ability to adopt newer technologies that could provide a better service to our members.

title: "Great place to work."
pros: Flexible schedule, great commissions, great people to work for.
cons: If there had to be a con, They closed our office down. They did offer to transfer our jobs for anyone that wanted to move to another center, and if not, they provided a great severence package.

title: "Marketing"
pros: Multiple career options; competitive salaries; some strong business leaders
cons: Extremely politcal, hierarchical and bureaucratic; weak Marketing leaders

title: "Sales"
pros: Lots of opportunity at this company.
cons: Management is a little old fashioned

title: "Non Injury Claim Associate"
pros: 401K, Benefits, Good Networking programs
cons: Need better compensation for promotions

title: "Horrible Leadership Ruining a Great Company"
pros: Excellent pay to start Great benefits including pension, but high deductible medical can be difficult Flex scheduling for some associates Great campus location and laid back atmosphere
cons: Technology is behind Managers do not appreciate nor accept a diverse culture Too many political games Favoritism and nepotism have ruined the talent pool and chances for advancement Discriminatory practices Bigoted and insecure middle management Raise structure is horrible Bonuses are a joke After coming in salaries are terrible Chances for advancement in other departments can be stalled by your current leader

title: "IT Manager"
pros: Compensation and benefits are competitive.
cons: Manager displayed negative attributes including lying on reviews, changing time entries to fit her needs, showing favoritism among subordinates, discouraging collaboration and training, expecting employees to find their own work (myself only, an example of favoritism), allowing certain employees comp time but not others, creating a toxic work environment.

title: "Claims Adjuster"
pros: Cares about employee development, good career mobility, fair salaries, incentives, time off and support.
cons: Benefits are lacking, care more about procedures than quality or results, out of touch top management.

title: "Great Company"
pros: Culture is undeniably affected by the historical roots of the company when it started as a small insurer to farmers. It is a somewhat laid back atmosphere but focused on doing what's best for the company and the members (customers).
cons: The laid back culture comes at a price and in the form of smaller salaries compared to other companies.

title: "agent"
pros: some good things are better than other companies
cons: some things are worse than other companies

title: "Great place to work in"
pros: Employee Engagement, Inputs appreciated and encouraged, Team-oriented ethos
cons: A little bit of power-struggle with Associates, minor insecurities with folks who have worked longer in the organization, that being normal in most places.

title: "Requirements Analyst"
pros: Fun environment, stable job, growing company, many learning opportunities.
cons: salary and time off seem lower than other places

title: "Member care Rep"
pros: Great Place to work and great benefits Free Parking A place you can work and make a career out of!
cons: Schedule is strict to adhere too and phone calls are steady busy Mangers is luck of the draw..all manage differently

title: "claims"
pros: great restaurant for lunch, nice grounds for afternoon walk
cons: Where do I begin? Very high school atmosphere such as affairs between employees, loud yelling at each other, older employees very negative about claims system. Older employees fast to tell you how they can't wait to retire and get hired as contract help to make the big bucks. Politically incorrect behavior that is accepted. Terrible negative comments about parent company Nationwide and how wonderful Scottsdale was before that BS company got involved. Always threats to resign by older employees. Its just a very negative place to work and new configuration of cubicles make it even worse because now you not only hear the negativity you see it.

title: "Member Care Representative"
pros: Management and supervisors were great, good atmosphere, very supportive environment, good benefits, paid time off was sufficient, would probably work here again
cons: Workload was excessive some days, unreasonable stats were expected with certain tasks, very rigid call flow, expect back to back calls all day

title: "Too Much Change Too Fast!!!"
pros: Great co-workers and good values on paper.
cons: Too many young leaders taking over with a significant lack of direction. Continual moving target! Corporate leadership has completely lost touch with the field. Stay away from the Loss Control Department

title: "working for an agency"
pros: learned a lot. learned a lot about business and insurance my coworkers wer great and mostly positive
cons: Working for an Agency, you arent technically anemployee of Nationwide. Corporate does not have any control over pay or benifits. Working on a 1099 taxes at a below minimum wage base, zero benifits, no sick days, and after a year i earned 5 days vacation days, most of which i used for sick days, and only being paid a flat $25 for a new policy i sold is a little rediculous, when asked if could be paid on renewals that was shot down. boss cared little about employees and more about going out and partying. amount of stress i was under landed me twice in the ER for chest pain and complications. customers were very holstile as agency owner was never in and not available to help out with various situations when they requested to speak with her only. wasnt worth the small pay check or the under appriciation to stay. agency owner was very superficial, constantly making sexist and weight remarks twoards employees or behind employees backs. no room for advancement or pay increases. just mroe resposibilty, added hours, mroe stress, same pay.

title: "MCR 1"
pros: Room for advancement if you are completely dedicated to the work life
cons: a lot of favoritism, short lunches,billing system is unorganized and very difficult to read or even explain to customers

title: "Screening Supervisor"
pros: Work/life balance is excellent. Benefits are decent. We receive decent amount of days off per year and have extra days for funeral time or adoption.
cons: Gallup rules Nationwide's world and isn't a true reflection of what really goes on.

title: "Great foot in the door of you can stand the terrible entry level job."
pros: Pay and benefits. Once a full time employee, you get 18 days off/year. That's about it. It's a great job on paper.
cons: Management. Advancement is only about who you know. The entry level job supervisors baby sit everyone. Talking to customers is terrible.

title: "Review Of Nationwide Insurance"
pros: Great people. Great environment. It is secure, protects employees and provides great benefits and discounts.
cons: I have none that I can think of at the moment.

title: "Review"
pros: Good work life balance, Access to top management, Cross functional team opportunities
cons: Lack of direction and inertia in departments

title: "Senior Analyst - IT Analysis"
pros: There is a lot of opportunity to move within the company allowing you to obtain a breadth of skills. The ESDm (Enterprise Solution Delivery methodology) processes used for projects are comprehensive. The use of Yammer (internal facebook-like site) to capitalize on the employees collective knowledge. Very supportive of training. Has its own internal weekly radio broadcast.
cons: Difficult to advance unless have breadth of cross-departmental (~3-5 positions) experience. Change in Management about every 12 - 18 months, which reflects the internal cultural expectation (I was told if I was in the same position 2 years that was too long). Low job morale (I suspect it is due to constant change in management and direction). Political.

title: "Do not work here"
pros: Employees are trained well for their roles and educated about the company culture.
cons: Everything else. Managers are not receptive to input. The work environment is hostile and cut throat. The workload is unreasonable, and there's a disconnect between the metrics and the reality on the ground. Lots of employees here suffer from sever anxiety and depression because of how poorly they are treated.

title: "Insurance CSR"
pros: Great Working environment, good benefit pkg.
cons: Working a lot of overtime.

title: "Overall a great company to work for"
pros: Flexibility, positive/engaged environment, good training, good management, autonomy is encouraged
cons: Low salary, very low bonuses/annual raises, promotions are politically based

title: "OK place to work"
pros: Pretty good benefits Stable Nationwide is not going anywhere anytime soon
cons: Technology is behind, and their attempts to catch up (i.e. go agile) are not working as well because only the IT side of things is changing while the business remains the same.

title: "Inside sales"
pros: I have very little positive to say about this company. The weight room is decent.
cons: Awful place to work. NSS is a boys club no chance of moving around if you're not in it.

title: "Total Loss Auto Adjuster"
pros: Focus on settling total loss vehicle claims to both policy holders and claimants. Speak with customers across the country experiencing the same issue, total loss to their vehicle.
cons: Dealing with customers who feel the value of their car is too low and unreasonable. Dealing with fatalities.

title: "Good place to work overall"
pros: Come to work everyday and do the best you can and you will thrive.
cons: There was a lot of "owes me" behavior when promotion time comes around.

title: "Manager"
pros: Great culture and is committed to the customer.
cons: Too much management from the top and not in the field. Disconnected

title: "Sr. Casualty Adjuster"
pros: The health benefits are good, generous PTO offered. If you can do well at Nationwide you can do well anywhere.
cons: The pay is not competitive. The work load is heavy. They live and die by metrics

title: "Great company to work for"
pros: As a mutual company, Nationwide has great work/life balance as well as job security. There is opportunity to work in many areas across the company. Additionally, given the balance between insurance and financial services, the company has a strong financial position. Gallup employee engagement scores are built into the compensation structure for management. This drives both desirable as well as undesirable behaviors.
cons: If you do not like the idea of working in Columbus or Scottsdale or Des Moines, depending on the role you're interested in, Nationwide may not be the place for you. Culturally, many areas of the company are not very open to temporary or long term virtual work arrangements. Unlike former places I have worked, I get the vibe that many senior leaders at Nationwide are arrogant (at the SVP level and above). This is CERTAINLY not true of all leaders, but it is a vibe that I have consistently felt during my experience here. While Nationwide is moving in the right direction uniting as one organization, and while it claims to be member-focused, culturally Nationwide has a long ways to go before it can truly say it is customer-centric in every breath it breathes. Base compensation is strong. However, annual performance bonuses and raises are very small (bonuses for non-leadership level roles will generally be around 1.5-2.5% depending on company performance; raises even for great performers may be at max around 4%). Additionally, while Nationwide has a pension, it is not a multiplying pension. That is, it's value is a mere percentage of your salary for each year worked, and does not grow much compared to a traditional pension. 401K matches 3% up to your 6% contributions.

title: "Claims Adjuster"
pros: The company has good benefits and long term benefits
cons: The claims departments are highly understaffed and the company is solely number driven

title: "Agency Field Sales Manager"
pros: Great Brand. Solid Financial Status. Excellent Life and Financial Services Company. Exclusive approach vs. captive. Can Broker if not eligible.
cons: Lack of strategy consistency. Not Price competitive. Constantly changing and reinventing go to market approach. Competing market channel silos - Exclusive, Direct and Independent.

title: "Decent place to work"
pros: Good benefits, pay and work environment
cons: Upper management doesn't seem to care much about other people

title: "Fun environment with easy workload"
pros: Friendly environment. Very helpful management. Easy workload and never have to work in extended hours.
cons: Chances of growth were very minimal. Work from was not allowed even once in a year.

title: "Home Care Representative"
pros: Good while it lasted for 10 years.
cons: Many people in my department were laid off.They ignored me and others after we tried to secure another position within the company. We received no response at all after being faithful employees for more than a decade. We were treated as badly as an outsider.

title: "Good company but stuck in the past"
pros: Financial strength of Nationwide. Good reputation in the industry. Loyal agents and employees
cons: There is a disconnect between what management believes is going on and what is actually going on. There are a lot of silos & people say they work together but don't. Few people challenge processes. Technology or strategies to keep current in the industry. Great place to work if you want to look busy but not do anything.

title: "Legal and Compliance"
pros: Interesting and fast paced. Decent amount of variet.
cons: Lots of deadlines and not enough people to do everything that needs to be done.

title: "Sales Management"
pros: It's a big company with great opportunity to learn a broad range of products and is financially strong. Nationwide generally has caring leaders that support associates and encourage professional development.
cons: It's hard to move up the corporate ladder if you haven't come to Nationwide with industry experience. There is a lot of conservatism around advancement and a lot of leaders don't hire the most talented individuals over the associates they have comfort with. The company is going through a major branding evolution and a number of areas and roles will be impacted based on expense cutting.

title: "Great place to work"
pros: Leadership, management, flexible time off, promote from within & training opportunities
cons: Promotions lead to below market value compensation while hires from outside negotiate salary.

title: "Direct Regional Sales Agent"
pros: Health insurance Time off Pay Youthful environment clean building
cons: Micromanagement is crazy. Can't take a small break off the phones without having someone on your back about it. Supervisors get on a power trip and pin point something new each month to pick at you for. No real managing going on besides once a month when a batch of people get written up for the same thing. Metrics are changing so much it's impossible to keep up with everything. You will always lack somewhere depending on what you're exceeding in. Metrics contradict each other instead of helping each other. Low accountability for those who aren't doing their job right. Too many eyes on you. Still working here because I need money......

title: "Great place to work"
pros: I love this company. I feel like management cares about employees, and I love the people I work with. In my office, there are many opportunities for advancement and to try other positions. PTO and benefits are great. Very low turnover in my office.
cons: It can be hard to stand out in a company this size. At times, working in claims can be very stressful, and you have to be very organized and on top of your work to hit your performance marks.

title: "Im happy"
pros: Doible time and a half on holidays, really helpful management staff
cons: No cons as of yet

title: "Great company to work for but their metrics suck"
pros: Company wise a great place to work, benefits, and employees are all great
cons: There system to grade you at your work is messed up. They make it impossible to get a good score and thats what determines your raises/bonuses.

title: "Non-Standard Auto"
pros: Good benefits, very relaxed environment with flexible work schedule.
cons: Some poor hiring decisions; lack of defined direction for the company (non-standard)

title: "Wonderful company to work for"
pros: Dedicated to it's employees Lots of opportunity, especially if you are open to relocation Very positive culture
cons: Not the highest pay in the market Change can sometimes come slowly

title: "Claims Specialist level 3, litigation"
pros: Co workers are great, flexibility is nice.
cons: Upper management removed from what the job actually entails. Metrics are out of control and not realistic

title: "Meh...Union environment"
pros: Pays well, good benefits, nice location
cons: Focused on soft items too much, most people have been coddled, and have difficulty taking direct feedback.

title: "Sr. Sales & Service Advocate"
pros: Large company so great opportunity for growth, provide great benefits, take good care of their employees and their clients
cons: Aircraft carrier vs. speed boat, takes a while to turn, therefore I'm looking for a company that can adapt to market conditions in a faster and more efficient manner

title: "Sales Agent"
pros: Great company to work for, very good salary.
cons: Not as many opportunities at my call center opposed to other centers we have.

title: "A great company, depending on the department and location"
pros: A company with a good heart but serious middle management problems. They truly care about the customer and doing what's right. Once you get past a certain level (somewhere around F or G band) then they really care about you as an employee too. Some managers and departments are awesome, some are awful. Great work/life balance in most departments.
cons: They see employees under G band as essentially replaceable (meaning probably 80% of the company). Nobody ever gets fired which means lots of deadwood still around. Raises are usually 2% and it's almost impossible to get a big one regardless of performance unless you get a promotion.

title: "Project Manager"
pros: Great culture and value employees.
cons: I can't think of any cons.

title: "Overall it isn"
pros: Treated like gold when things are good.
cons: Short term memory..what have you done for me lately.

title: "like family"
pros: family like atmosphere, great work life balance, opportunity for development, better than average technology, opportunity to give your feedback to the highest levels.
cons: downsizing to 6 p&c locations, not allowing some employees to work from home instead of moving, constant requests to help nationwide hire employees even though my own job is being eliminated

title: "Commercial Insurance Agent"
pros: Great atmosphere. Many opportunities for growth and development. Excellent benefits and pay.

title: "Security"
pros: Fair management, fitness area on site at the larger campuses. Warm(feel-good) environments, and the facilities are well maintained.
cons: Health insurance recently went to high deductible plans.

title: "Great Experience"
pros: Professional Development was encouraged and supported by bringing in resources for workshops and training The people who work there are truly the best part of Nationwide....they attract talented people who care about each other and look for ways to bring out the best in everyone
cons: Not a lot of cons....probably a bit top heavy in terms of people; too many higher level executives and some teams may be overburdened with workload and expected knowledge

title: "LOVE IS IN THE AIR"
pros: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! EXCELLENT COMPANY!!!!!
cons: none. They are always trying to genuinely improve

title: "Processor"
pros: Flexibility with work hours and opportunities to work from home. Pay is really good for area.
cons: Processing Center in Canton is closing.

title: "Nice exposure as a beginner"
pros: Lovely atmosphere, nice people to work with
cons: Can't think of any !!!

title: "Great Company, Not a Great Regional Office"
pros: It's a great company to work for especially if you are mobile. They give you plenty of training for your position and are very supportive of development.
cons: If you are in a small regional office there are not as many opportunities for advancement as there are a lot of long-term seat warmers in leadership. Many of the regional offices are on a schedule to close in the future.

title: "Requirements Analyst"
pros: Challenging work, cross functional team
cons: Slow paced, laid back culture

title: "Specialist"
pros: Management really does care about its people. Job growth on every level and hard work is rewarded. Flexible shifts with possible work from home options.
cons: No clear job paths. Takes a lot of work to understand the business and understanding your impact can be hard at times.

title: "Lead Consultant"
pros: Very good working environment, flexible and enjoyable. Good salary and good management.
cons: Sometimes it feels it is very slow.

title: "Associate Claims Adjuster"
pros: Friendly management and coworkers. I enjoyed the work, it is fast pace so the time goes by fast. It's a friendly social work environment.
cons: Pay is at the low end for associate claims adjusters. I did not like working the weekends nor working past 5:30 pm.

title: "Excellent company"
pros: 1. Good benefits (want to call out the pension plan) 2. Good opportunities to diversify your experience 3. Decent management 4. Work life balance
cons: 1. Sometimes the contractors bully the employees (too much freedom for these contractors) 2. Sometimes its hard to get the individual commitment from those that are settled thru retirement

title: "Eh....OK if you want stability"
pros: No one gets fired, that includes you. This gives you employment job security on par with government jobs
cons: Cost area accounting taken to the extreme, the whole no one gets fired includes all the dead weight. Depending on the area, management is incompetent. In the interview, make sure you after work the management. In some areas, you get promoted based on the food ole boy network and nothing else matters.

title: "Most awful work environment I've ever experienced!!!"
pros: Nationwide Insurance (the company itself) is a good company. It has great products and very competitive pricing. However, the MCKINNEY AGENCY is a terrible place to work!!!
cons: The McKinney Agency is run by a husband, wife and their son. The entire family is extremely dysfunctional! I've never worked at a company where family members are yelling, cussing, screaming at each other and slamming doors on a regular basis! And they treat their staff very poorly.

title: "Work Experience for IT department"
pros: Great work life balance. Promotes collaboration and giving back to the community
cons: Lot of Silos, Risk Averse and Slow to adapt to change

title: "Casualty Claims Adjuster"
pros: Flexible schedule- worked from a home location
cons: Overwhelming claims volume.

title: "Great company, work life balance, meaningful work, and good pay."
pros: Time off, work life balance, salary, helping people, friendly culture.
cons: Slow moving, long time to become director, some poor managers have upped through the cracks making it on the work of others they have taken credit for.

title: "Great work environment"
pros: Great work environment, always connected to my teammates and supervisors. I felt welcome at work and that everyone cared about each other's development.
cons: Sometimes the work load can be overwhelming. We can get understaffed.

title: "Non Injury Liability Claims Adjuster"
pros: flexable, good benefits, company car
cons: work load, work life balance

title: "I am a part time sales agent and so far I love the culture and environment the company has to offer."
pros: You work as hard as you want to. It's really up to you how big you want your check to be.
cons: Training feels like forever long! They definitely make sure you a re fully prepared to sell insurance.

title: "IT specialist"
pros: Great manager and freedom to work on my own.
cons: Job is not as challenging as I would like it to be.

title: "Internship experience"
pros: Nationwide is a great family-like company to work for. They really do structure the work culture around their mission statement. Tons of room for candidates/prospects to grow.
cons: hinestly, there were no cons in my experience. They even paid well for an intern

title: "Like a step back in time, say 1970"
pros: Company gives back to the communities it serves
cons: IT runs the business and they run it poorly

title: "Excellent company minus the conservative side of insuring"
pros: Well known brand, easy to sell. People love to be a part of the club
cons: Conservative rules of insurance

title: "Good, not great place to work"
pros: most people move at a snail's pace, plus there is a lot of movement between departments, so plenty of opportunity to try new roles or be promoted managers care about your development and you as a person work/life balance, 38.75 hour work week
cons: HSA rates have gone up over 20% 2 years in a row too many are enabled to not take risks and do just enough to get by. can be frustrating when you are passionate about your work. in many areas of the company, fixation on process bogs down progress.

title: "great place to work"
pros: work cullture , people, and also easy going. nt much work pressure. people ar there to help you in all sort of troubles
cons: not much benifits , lot of dependency on tools. sometime takes more tme becaue of dependeny on tools. selection ispretty random.

title: "Not very good experience.  They are not on your side."
pros: Would of liked to continue to work for them but they eliminated my position and hired someone else with less experience and for less money. They also outsource alot of work to India.
cons: Eliminated positions after a company merger.

title: "Pl underwriting"
pros: Educational reimbursement, 401k company match, pension
cons: Structural re-organizing every 6 years, eliminating tenure and jobs.

title: "good so far but low starting pay heavily based on commission"
pros: commission and salary, good work atmosphere, good employees
cons: commission with low salary to start, must produce only new business on sales

title: "Great resume builder for sales"
pros: Easy commission, lots of room to learn and gain knowledge about sales and the insurance industry. Not a really hard service/product to sell
cons: No real chances for advancement unless you want to open your own agency

title: "Overall good experience however people are not always first priority as they preach."
pros: Laid back work environment and opportunities for growth
cons: You feel easily replaceable compared to smaller carriers with more family type environment

title: "Love this company! They definitely know how to compensate the agents that choose to work hard for their money!"
pros: Generous compensation, plenty of paid time off, flexible schedule.
cons: Not really much to speak of here. Everything is pretty on par with other companies.

title: "Ok place to work"
pros: Workmates are mostly friendly but those who are near retirement can be impossible to work with. I like the 38.75 hr workweek. Salary is quite good.
cons: Benefits are quite poor for such a large company. They do have a pension but health care costs are high for only having high deductible health plan options. My location is clearing out one by one as I doubt we will be around after 2019 (everything moving to Columbus). Office politics can be a bit much at times.

title: "Great Place to work"
pros: great team building activities, great leadership
cons: inconsistent work environment within the department

title: "Claims-staff was great, mangement had its own challenges"
pros: Very knowledgeable to work with on claims
cons: Too much back stabbing to get ahead, too much gossip

title: "Ok experience, management doesn't care about its employees"
pros: Co workers are nice and helpful
cons: Takes a while for raises and promotions

title: "Mediocre"
pros: Great Benefits, but that is about it
cons: Managers aren't always for you

title: "Satisfied Employee"
pros: Benefits, staff, culture, work/life balance
cons: Big brother NW, focus on Run work and less on new build

title: "Ok place to work"
pros: The salary is pretty good
cons: can be difficult to keep clients in this industry

title: "Feel betrayed by company that I had high regard of respect for"
pros: In the beginning this was a great place to work. I loved my job and then they cut our dept of 14 full time associates to 7 and expected us to be able to do the same amount of work. They raised targets so high that most couldn't reach them.
cons: Well with optimization that is going on we were told that it was highly unlikely that our dept would be eliminated because we were way ahead of Ohio. They brought in more work and had us get everything set up and running smoothly just so they could have it ready to be shipped to Ohio.

title: "total loss department"
pros: Holiday pay, paid time off
cons: Everything besides holidays and pto

title: "I loved working there."
pros: Great people to work with.
cons: Pay could be a little better

title: "IA Intern"
pros: the people, the location, the atmosphere
cons: the parking and the training

title: "Great Company if you know the right people"
pros: a great company in terms of compensation and autonomy. The company wants you to feel like your part of a family. There are wonderful benefits and if you are mobile there are opportunities.
cons: There is almost no diversity (gender or race) above the director level. People get promoted often not based on talent but who they know. The leadership is not reflective to the membership base that it serves. Unfortunately if you are looking for a company that promotes diversity based on talent and not popularity, gender or skin color....Nationwide is not for you. You will find yourself frustrated and looking for another company to work for.

title: "Awesome! Very friendly and encouraging people!"
pros: Encourage you to perform different activities. Very friendly
cons: Salary is a little low compared to others.

title: "Wrong fit"
pros: Pay wasn't bad. Facilities were great.
cons: Was required to be a very pushy sales person over the phone to meet quotas. This was especially hard in certain states were the company wasn't competitive. Management didn't seem to care.

title: "Awesome"
pros: Great place to work here
cons: Parking in the down town area

title: "Great Environment"
pros: Everybody is really outgoing and not afraid to help you. A lot of chatting going on around you but there is still a lot of work getting done.
cons: Sometimes there is a lot of projects that are all very time sensitive so it makes it hard to prioritize.

title: "Great place to learn and grow"
pros: Great company culture to learn and grow. Willingness of team members to teach. Clear, reasonable expectations. Fun, friendly place to be
cons: Since it's a larger, older company, lots of bureaucracy and some out-dated tech remains. Seems like they're shifting to get rid of it, however.

title: "Great company, small presence in Sacramento, limited opportunities"
pros: Small office creates easier access to higher level executives and managers. This can also sometimes lead to less competition for jobs in the region.
cons: Small office, limited segment presence, less actual job opportunities since there are not as many positions in this region. Pay is not completely adequate for the cost of living compared to pay in other regions with lower cost of living.

title: "Good company to work but......"
pros: Great benefits, growth opportunities,
cons: Some dumb people, good old boys club

title: "Extremely poor change management, overworked employees"
pros: My paycheck was direct deposited on time every two weeks.
cons: Extremely poor change management (one not-so-small-example) - The company decided to change claims managements systems and did not provide job specific training on how the system should be used. Did not survey users in specific job functions to see how the system should be adapted to promote effective/efficient claims processing - basically, they decided to go with a generic claims system that was implemented prior to customizing it to fit the needs of the company causing unimaginable stress and loss of production. The workforce was left floundering around while still being expected to maintain goals and accountabilities, while management refused to acknowledge the blunder.

title: "Great company to grow with!"
pros: Many marketing opportunities, rewarded for skills, and excellent team. I was there for 5 years and as I move through my life and my career, I realize it was one of the best experiences that helped to shape me as a marketer. Benefits are decent, better than others I have worked for.
cons: You have to be your own advocate for growth, but opportunities are definitely there. Office culture is professional and fun. I made some friends for a lifetime there.

title: "Very pleasant place to work with great benefits."
pros: -Work life balance encouraged and practiced -benefits -Lots of advancement opportunity -great training and development opportunities -opportunity to move laterally - great transparency from leadership
cons: - large company, can be tough to stand out and be unique - a mutual company so innovation can be stagnant due to no need to please shareholders with significant profit

title: "I have enjoyed the atmosphere."
pros: Great benefits. Flexibility. Great employees.
cons: Corporate reorganization is causing our regional office to relocate to another city.
